title: General Body Meetings (GBMs)
description: These events are held a few times a quarter and serve to update members on what's currently going on; these are great opportunities to get involved and learn more about the organization. Plus, there are usually fun activities planned, so feel free to just get together and hang out!

title: Mixers & Socials
description: The aim of these events are to provide a space for fostering community, whether that's among students (at socials) or with first-gen faculty, staff, and industry professionals (mixers).

title: First-Gen Fridays
description: A weekly engagement opportunity, such as a meal, social gathering, or a place to study together. Come out and get to meet new people! Food is typically provided during these events.

title: Tabling
description: FGSA and other first-gen communities (e.g. Triton Firsts) will often be out tabling on Library Walk or for events! Stop by our table and say hi, or learn more about our organization.
